title: Bisphenol A
summary: Bisphenol A (BPA) is a chemical compound and one of the simplest and best known bisphenols. It is produced by the condensation of phenol and acetone, with an estimated 4 million tonnes of produced worldwide in 2015.[2] It is a colourless solid which is soluble in organic solvents, but poorly soluble in water (0.344 wt % at 83 °C).[3]
